Plantwise module

src.vLab.IntegratedBioprocess.Plantwise.plantwise(t, x, u_F, u_Cin, tran=None)[source]

Compute the derivatives of plantwise simulator, which is a first order ODE system

\[\frac{dx}{dt}(r) = \text{plantwise}(t, x,\ldots), x(t0) = x0\]

Here t is a 1-D independent variable (time), y(t) is an N-D vector-valued function (state), and an N-D vector-valued function f(t, y) determines the differential equations. The goal is to find y(t) approximately satisfying the differential equations, given an initial value y(t0)=y0.

Parameters

  • t (2-tuple of floats) – Interval of integration (t0, tf). The solver starts with t=t0 and integrates until it reaches t=tf.

  • x (array) – Initial condition on x (can be a vector).

  • u_F (array) – flow rates of bioreactor, harvest tank and chromatograph (load/wash/elute) at time t

  • u_Cin (array) – inlet concentrations at time t

  • tran (array) – Cumulated process time

Return dxdt

derivatives of plantwise models

Return type

array

src.vLab.IntegratedBioprocess.Plantwise.plantwise_julia(x, data, t)[source]
Compute the derivatives of plantwise simulator, which is a first order ODE system. Note: The plantwise_julia

support the function format required by diffeqpy

Parameters

  • t (2-tuple of floats) – Interval of integration (t0, tf). The solver starts with t=t0 and integrates until it reaches t=tf.

  • x (array) – Initial condition on y (can be a vector).

  • data (ndarray) – assembly of (1) flow rates of bioreactor, harvest tank and chromatograph (load/wash/elute); (2) inlet concentrations; (3) bioreactor model parameters; (4) chromatography model parameters; (5) Cumulated process time.

Return dxdt

derivatives of plantwise models

Return type

array
